net.jxta.ext.config
Class RdvProperties

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.jxta.ext.config.RdvProperties
public class RdvProperties
extends java.lang.Object

Default RendezVousService properties. This class is intended to be used in order to read or write the RendezVousService configurable into the platform property file (jxta.properties). RdvProperties does not interfere with other properties that other JXTA service may have added into the property file.

Field Detail

PROPERTIES_FILENAME

public static final java.lang.String PROPERTIES_FILENAME
The RendezVousService uses a file in the classpath directory, named jxta.properties in order to allow configuration. PROPERTY_FILENAME is the name of the configuration file used by the PeerView.

Method Detail

setRdvMonitorLeaseMargin

public long setRdvMonitorLeaseMargin(long newVal)
Set RdvMonitor.LeaseMargin configurable in jxta.properties Edge peers renew their lease to the RDV peer LeaseMargin (in ms) before the expiration of the lease. Enough time should be given to allow the lease to be renewed before the expiration of the lease. If not configured, the default value is 5 Minutes (300000 milliseconds).

Parameters:
newVal - new value in ms
Returns:
long old value

getRdvMonitorLeaseMargin

public long getRdvMonitorLeaseMargin()
Get RdvMonitor.LeaseMargin

Returns:
long value

setRdvMonitorDefaultLease

public long setRdvMonitorDefaultLease(long newVal)
Set RdvMonitor.DefaultLease configurable in jxta.properties The RDV lease used by the RdvMonitor is: MIN (RdvMonitor.DefaultLease, lease returned by rdv peer). As a result, an edge peer may detect the failure of its rdv peer only the time of lease renewal (worse case situation). The default value is 20 minutes. Increasing this value may increase the latency for an edge peer to detect failure of its rdv peer, but increase network scalability. Decreasing this value decreases the latency to detect rdv failure, but increases network traffic and load on rdv peers (decrease scalability).

Parameters:
newVal - new value in ms
Returns:
long old value

getRdvMonitorDefaultLease

public long getRdvMonitorDefaultLease()
Get RdvMonitor.DefaultLease

Returns:
long value

setRdvManagerMaxClients

public int setRdvManagerMaxClients(int newVal)
Set RdvManager.MaxClients configurable in jxta.properties When a peer runs as a rdv peer, this configurable sets the maximum number of clients the rendezvous service will accept at any given time. The default is 200.

Parameters:
newVal - new value
Returns:
int old value

getRdvManagerMaxClients

public int getRdvManagerMaxClients()
Get RdvMonager.MaxClients

Returns:
int value

setPeerViewProbeRelays

public void setPeerViewProbeRelays(boolean newVal)
Set peerview.ProbeRelays configurable in jxta.properties If set to true, the PeerView protocol will send a PeerView query to its relays. Edge peers that turn this configurable on will be able to connect to a rdv peer, even if their relay(s) is not a seeding rdv peer as well.

Parameters:
newVal - new value
Returns:
int old value

getPeerViewProbeRelays

public boolean getPeerViewProbeRelays()
Get peerview.ProbeRelays

Returns:
boolean value

setRdvWatchdog

public long setRdvWatchdog(long newVal)
Set Rdv.Rdv-Watchdog configurable in jxta.properties When a peer runs as an edge peer, and when AutoRdv is enabled, this configurable sets the delay before the edge peer starts acting as a rdv peer in the absence of rdv connection. Default is 5 minutes.

Parameters:
newVal - new value (in ms)
Returns:
int old value

getRdvWatchdog

public long getRdvWatchdog()
Get Rdv.Rdv-Watchdog

Returns:
long value

setPeerViewSeedingConnDelay

public long setPeerViewSeedingConnDelay(long newVal)
Set peerview.SeedingRdvConnDelay configurable in jxta.properties Delay before a peer sends a PeerView request to the seeding RDV peers. Default is 0 (zero).

Parameters:
newVal - new value (in seconds).
Returns:
int old value

getPeerViewSeedingConnDelay

public long getPeerViewSeedingConnDelay()
Get peerview.SeedingRdvConnDelay configurable in jxta.properties

Returns:
long value (in seconds).
